results.title: Murray River quest (A)
results.brief_description: This is the story of Australia’s greatest river seen through the eyes of two canoeists on an expedition seeking the history of the river and it’s importance in the development of Victoria and New South Wales. It tells of the Aborigines, explorers and town founders; of irrigators, woodcutters and fishermen - all those people whose lives and adventures make up the history of the Murray River.

results.title: John McCrae's war: in Flanders Fields
results.creator_credit: Robert Duncan, Barbara Shearer, Jonathon Desbarats, International Documentary Television Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Every year veteran organisations hand out millions of synthetic poppies on November 11 - Remembrance Day - but what about John McCrae, poet and physician, who penned the famous lines “In Flanders Fields”. The author of the most famous Canadian war poem ever written remains relatively unknown. This documentary tells the story of John McCrae from his childhood in Guelph, Ontatrio, through medical school at the University of Toronto to the second battle of Ypres in Belgium. The war with all it’s horrors had a profound effect on McCrae along with the death of a close soldier friend; he penned his most famous poem after his friend’s death. McCrae was never the same after leaving the front, his health failed and he died in 1918 without knowing the outcome of the war and was buried in France. This tribute to his life and work will make people remember his life and work and to think about the poem that meant so much to the people who fought and died in that awful war.

results.title: Wildfire!
results.creator_credit: Jeff Myrow, Ronox Productions and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: The tragic saga of the Wenatchee forest fire, one of history’s worst, and the heroic efforts to combat it, is documented hour-by-hour and day-by-day. 8,500 fire fighters faced the flames and dense smoke for 16 days, and bulldozers, aeroplanes and helicopters were also used. Finally there is silence and stillness, after decimation of hundreds of years’ growth.

results.title: The Natural world: the witness was a fly
results.brief_description: Narrated by Dr Zakaria Erzinclioglu who specialises in using flies as a means of crime detection in forensic science, this program profiles actual cases across the globe and interviews experts in the field to illustrate how the evidence of plants, animals and nature have proven or disproven cases. It takes an in depth look at the procedures and testing that takes place in the laboratories and outlines what different plants, animals and insects can offer in solving crime.

results.title: Kid nerd
results.creator_credit: Shereen Jerrett, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Former self confessed ‘nerds’, offer candid views on what it was like to be isolated and bullied in high school and how their lives have turned out. Although those interviewed share their moments of past pain, most of them have gone on to successful and creative ventures, which may have only been possible because of their distinct personalities. An entertaining documentary that nerds and non nerds alike will be able to relate to.

results.title: Aileen Wuornos: the selling of a serial killer
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Rieta Oord and Lafayette Films
results.brief_description: Dubbed “America’s first female serial killer”, prostitute Aileen Wuornos killed seven men between 1990-91. While she claims self-defence and then is later persuaded by her “supporters” to change her plea, Broomfield skillfully reveals the layers of truth that surround the case. By implication, Broomfield disarmingly and ironically identifies himself as one of those attempting to gain from the “Wuornos Industry”.

results.title: 20 years of African cinema = Camera d'Afrique: the young Arab cinema = Camera Arabe
results.brief_description: Shot on a low budget, ‘Camera d’Afrique’ chronicles 20 years of African, predominantly Francophone West African, cinema. The earliest film, ‘Borom Sarret’ (Ousmane Sembene) is from 1963, and ‘Finye’ (Souleymane Cisse), the most recent title from 1983. The documentary also covers the importance of Film Festivals in Tunis and Ouagadougou to African cinema, the debates of the Panafrican Film-Makers’ Federation (Fepaci), as well as the emergence of directors in the 1980’s. ‘Camera Arabe’, Boughedir’s second major documentary looks at the new Arab cinema of the post-colonial era, an era which owes its greatest debt to Egyptian director, Youssef Chahine. New Arab cinema must contend with Government influence and find itself an audience in an industry that is saturated with imported material. Boughedir interviews film-makers from North Africa as well as the wider Arab world and provides clips from a number of clips from key Arab films. On a critical level, ‘Camera Arabe’ investigates notions of memory, the role of women in Arab culture and the problematic identity of the Arab male.

results.title: Outnumbered
results.creator_credit: Richard Keddie, Andrew Wiseman, Apollo Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary provides a candid look behind the 1996 election campaign of the Victorian Opposition Labor Party, headed by John Brumby. He has a number of factors working against him in a seemingly unwinnable campaign; a drastically low budget, poor public perception, and healthy support for the Coalition. This documentary focuses on John Brumby as an individual who is honest and frank in his opinions, as well as illustrating how the media is capable of shaping public opinion and in turn dictating the creation of the images of modern politics.

results.title: Divorce Iranian style
results.creator_credit: Ziba Mir-Hosseini, Kim Longinotto and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Set in a Tehran courtroom before Judge Deldar, this documentary by British documentary filmmaker Longinotto follows the plight of three women who must provide a convincing argument to grant them a divorce. An insightful look which shatters the myth that Muslim women are passive, especially when their happiness is at stake.

results.title: First Fleet: rite of passage
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, Michael Balson, Bill Leimbach, First Fleet Re-enactment Company and Orana Films
results.brief_description: Produced to commemorate Australia’s Bicentenary (1988), this video captures the official First Fleet Reenactment Voyage in 200 minutes of action and adventure. Witness the trials and tribulations of the modern day voyagers who took part in the voyage from Portsmouth on 13 May 1987 to the spectacular finale on Sydney Harbour on Australia Day, 26 January 1988.
